Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2007 07:04AM lafs61054 wrote: Hi, I had a lumpectomy in Oct. 07, re-excision in Dec. 07.  I have a high pain threshold, but when I woke up from the 2nd surgery I had a lot of pain.  The nurse gave me two doses of fentayl before the pain started to subside.  I have had numbness in my arm pit, tingling and numbness of my arm and sharp shooting pain in my breast.  I also have pain in my back on the right side, especially by my shoulder blade.  I had six weeks of radiation and wound up with inflammation of my rib cartilege which went on for weeks.  When I told my doctor about the pain, etc. he said it unfortunately, might be permanent.  Certain activities make the pain worse - long car rides, for one thing, holding my small grandchildren is another factor.  I have tylenol with codeine which I take only when absolutely necessary - I hate taking pills!!  Massage also helps.  Again, it's a shame that more doctors don't recognize this syndrome since it seems like there are a lot of women who suffer from chronic pain after surgery.
